The MOST effective way for an instructor to demonstrate active listening is to: establish eye contact with the learner.

Although displaying open body language and restating the learner's question are also effective ways to demonstrate active listening, establishing eye contact is the most crucial as it conveys to the learner that the instructor is paying attention and interested in what they have to say.

choices.A: Let the instructor keep on going because the training has to get done
choices.D: Go to a private chat and explain to the instructor what they are doing wrong
choices.B: Have the instructor explain the colloquialisms to the learner and go on

questions.question_text: An instructor is being observed while teaching a virtual class with learners from different parts of the country. During the presentation the instructor uses a few colloquialisms. Which of the following is the BEST action for the observer to take?

discussion.content:
B. Have the instructor explain the colloquialisms to the learner and go on

It is important for the instructor to explain any colloquialisms or jargon that may be unfamiliar to the learners in order to ensure that they fully understand the material being presented. This approach will also help to create a more inclusive learning environment for all learners, regardless of their background or regional dialect. Simply letting the instructor continue without addressing the issue may result in confusion or misunderstandings among the learners, which can ultimately hinder their ability to learn and retain the information being presented.

questions.question_text: An instructor is previewing the class materials for a course. The instructor notices that a method to monitor learner progress is not included with the course materials. Which of the following should the instructor do NEXT?

discussion.content:
D. Develop appropriate questions to be included during the course to monitor the progress of all learners.

If the method to monitor learner progress is not included in the course materials, the instructor should create a plan to monitor learner progress during the course. Developing appropriate questions to be included during the course is the best option to monitor learner progress in real-time. This will allow the instructor to adjust the course delivery based on the level of understanding demonstrated by the learners, ensuring that all the learners can follow the course material. Administering a survey following the course or encouraging learners to enroll in a subsequent class may be helpful in some contexts, but it will not provide the instructor with the immediate feedback needed to make adjustments during the course. Consulting the client may be necessary in the long term, but it will not help the instructor monitor the learner's progress during the course.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST important issue to consider when identifying the target audience for a training program?

choices.C: The knowledge and skill of the participants
choices.B: How much the program will cost
choices.D: The type of incentive to provide for completing the training

discussion.content: C. The knowledge and skill of the participants is the MOST important issue to consider when identifying the target audience for a training program. Understanding the level of knowledge and skills of the target audience will help to determine the appropriate content, delivery methods, and level of difficulty for the training program.

questions.question_text: When a learner leans back and crosses their arms in response to a direct question, this MOST likely indicates they:

choices.A: Know the answer but do not want to share it with the rest of the class
choices.D: Are interested, invested but considering their response carefully
choices.C: Are uncomfortable with their knowledge of the correct answer
choices.B: Are indifferent to the question and want to be disruptive to the class

discussion.content:
Option D is the correct answer: 
"Are interested, invested but considering their response carefully."

The most likely interpretation of a learner leaning back and crossing their arms in response to a direct question is that they are interested and invested in the question but considering their response carefully. This body language can indicate that the learner is thinking and processing the information before giving a thoughtful response.

Therefore, option D is the correct answer: "Are interested, invested but considering their response carefully."
